title: 10. Citizens
description: The rights, duties, and political participation of Athenian citizens.

questions.question: Which political rights did all Athenian citizens possess?
options: Proposing legislation, attending the Assembly, and voting

questions.question: How were most political offices filled in Athens?
Which offices were elected rather than chosen by lot?
Why were annual tenures significant for citizens?
options: They allowed many citizens to gain political experience

questions.question: What role did citizens play in the law courts?
options: They served as jurors deciding verdicts and punishments

questions.question: Why were officials and jurors paid?
options: To allow wider participation regardless of wealth

questions.question: Approximately how many citizens lived in Athens in the fifth century BCE?
Roughly what proportion of the population were citizens?
What legal protection distinguished citizens from non-citizens?
options: Citizens were exempt from military service

questions.question: What was expected of wealthy citizens through liturgy?
options: Funding public services such as drama or warships

questions.question: What was a choregos?
options: A citizen who funded dramatic festivals

questions.question: What was required for a male to be recognised as a citizen after Pericles’ reforms?
At what age did a boy normally begin the process of becoming a citizen?
Which body scrutinised young men before full citizenship?
How could citizenship be granted in exceptional cases?
options: By a vote of the Assembly

questions.question: Why might some citizens be temporarily excluded from political participation?
options: Suspension for debts or legal penalties
